sub_title: Founder & CEO, Keynote Speaker, Futurist Designer, Impact & Innovation
summary:
Marti Grimminck is a global business executive, social entrepreneur, keynote speaker, and futurist designer. As the Founder and CEO of International Connector, a multi-service consultancy that provides next generation insights and solutions, she leads projects for corporations and governments on ‘future of work’ research and workforce development programs. 

For 15 years, Marti has researched and designed products, programs and services for companies targeting younger generations (GenZs and Millennials) as employees and as consumers. She is known for her global and diverse reach engaging young people across 190 countries in the process. 

With a strong belief in social responsibility, Marti has developed and designed a portfolio of social impact programs including: @Your Big Year® training young leaders, @Innovative Resilience building connected resilient communities, and @Future of Women in Tech elevating women leaders in business. Her trademark utilizes technology as an enabler for social change.

treasury_media.title: Review: ‘Brilliant Mind’ is digital theater that actually uses technology in a new way
treasury_media.description: The production utilizes digital gadgetry that enhances storytelling in inventive ways, including a texting component that engages audiences.

treasury_media.title: Planning for the workforce of tomorrow
treasury_media.description: In collaboration with Microsoft Real Estate Group and Gensler. Technology is radically transforming the workplace, and young workers are on the forefront of this evolution. What will they expect from employers, and what ...

treasury_media.title: Connecting Puerto Rico: Viasat social impact
treasury_media.description: In partnership with Viasat, International Connector helped connect and empower thousands of community members through the building and connecting of an innovation hub in Puerto Rico.

treasury_media.title: She Works with Millennials and GenZ Innovators to Change the Way We Do Business
treasury_media.description: Marti Grimminck’s creative approach to human engagement is changing the definition of business-as-usual

treasury_media.title: Keynote: The Future of Leadership
treasury_media.description: Keynote: Marti Grimminck, Founder, International Connector What is leadership today? What does it mean to be a leader in this changing business landscape, particularly for women? Who are the new leaders of today and tomorrow, and what are the qualities that make them leaders?

treasury_media.title: Marti Grimminck, Interview at The Class of 2020 Conference -
treasury_media.description: What do Millennials want in student accommodation? International Connector Marti Grimminck shares her ideas: Bring in the fun!

treasury_media.title: What GenerationZ wants in Travel - ITB Berlin
treasury_media.description: Marti Grimminck, founder and CEO of International Connector, was back at ITB Berlin this year.

awards.description: The Hivery We Rise Scholarship honors an organization working for equal treatment of human beings regardless of gender, race, beliefs, age, income, or sexual orientation. The Hivery's co-working space and initiative for women is transforming the way we support and inspire women to make an impact.

projects.title: Institute For The Future - Future Foods Think Tank
projects.description: International Connector and Institute for the Future partnered to create a virtual think tank about the future of food. A curated group of youth from close to 30 countries worked share their experiences about food in their home countries and to ideate and to discuss what will effect the future of food.

projects.title: Athens Millennial Tourism Think Tank
projects.description: Athens is a city with an ancient past, but a pressing need to look to the future. To ensure that the city can continue to excite and enchant a new generation of visitors while giving local young Athenians a stake in the city’s future, a bold new approach was needed. With a stellar team working with Athens Development and Destination Management Agency, International Connector designed and led a think tank at the Travel Trade Athens 2014, as well as an online think tank with millennials worldwide.  The results were outstanding and will be published soon.

projects.title: Your Big Year 3
projects.description:
Your Big Year is a global competition based on social entrepreneurship and global citizenship. In its third run and a feature event of Global Entrepreneurship Week and San Francisco Innovation Month, YBY saw over 60,000 contestants from over 200 countries/territories sign up. Over 6 months time we whittled the competition down to 12 Champions from 10 different countries. 

In Nov, we flew 12 to San Francisco for "Finals' Week," to compete in an array of competitive tasks and leadership development with companies such as Google, Vodafone, Bloomberg, Dalai Lama Fellows, Deloitte Center for the Edge, Yes to Carrots, Bloomberg and more.

authors.headline: Founder & CEO, Keynote Speaker, Futurist Designer, Impact & Innovation

profile_positions.description:
Designed, managed and facilitated:
•	‘Generational Pulse’ providing global insights and advisory of emerging generations from across 190 countries to major corporations innovation teams such as Microsoft, Google.
•	Creative innovation process 'Rethink, Reimagine, Redesign' utilized by corporations worldwide.
•	‘Innovative Resilience’ in Puerto Rico bringing Viasat satellite connectivity, technology and digital skills training to communities devastated by Hurricane Maria.
•	‘Global Citizens Challenge’ virtual cultural exchange bringing youth together from 106 countries and forming over 800 new friendships per each 6 runs.
•	‘Make An Impact’ Fellowship curriculum and virtual learning providing bridging skills from academia to career for thousands of youth in over 80 countries.
•	Student Ambassador Programs including IBM zSystems.
•	‘Your Big Year’ youth empowerment program impacting over 250,000 youth from 190 countries.
•	‘Future of Women in Tech’ program with Australian Chamber of Commerce, SF with 4 events in Australia and two virtual events in San Francisco and Washington DC.
•	the production of DisruptHers podcast produced by Winston and Strawn LLP.
•	Global Citizens Challenge for schools pilot bringing a 3-day interactive transformative learning experience to schools in Maryland and Washington DC.
•	Remote working learning series for TechSoup covering topics on managing a team remotely, designing virtual events and engaging and managing a community virtually.
profile_positions.title: Founder & CEO

profile_positions.description:
Keynotes, interactive presentations, and facilitation on topics related to future generations and their impact on business today. Recent topics include: Future of Work, GenerationZ and the Future Workforce, GenZ Consumers, Hybrid Workforce, Creating a Company Culture Virtually, Future of Women In Tech, Social Impact and Market Leaders in the Future, Technology for Good. In addition, Female Leadership, Female Entrepreneurship. 

Featured at events and conference worldwide from Berlin to Sydney, from Bangkok to London, from New York to Dubai, from San Francisco to San Juan. Duke Corporate Education, ITB Berlin, Clinton Global Initiative, NetHope, SOCAP, National Beer Wholesalers Association, HR Disrupt, Class of 2020, IEEE, Travel Industry Executive Women, National Trust for Historic Preservation, International Society for Hospitality Consultants, Australian Computer Society, etc
profile_positions.title: Keynote Speaker

profile_positions.description: At Your Big Year, we envision a world where young people can reach their full capacity and apply their unique capabilities to solving the world’s most pressing challenges. Working with youth across 190 countries, our long-term goal is to provide equitable opportunities as we believe anyone can make an impact - big or small.
profile_positions.title: Executive Director

profile_positions.description: Innovative Resilience brings technology solutions and training to emerging markets, underserved communities and disaster response.
profile_positions.title: Executive Director

profile_positions.description:
The Atlantic Council GeoTech Center encourages global tech collaborations, evaluates good tech choices as well as measurable policy alternatives, and educates world leaders and the public on issues related to global tech competition. 

We champion positive paths forward that nations, economies, and societies can pursue to ensure new technologies and data empower people, increase prosperity, and secure peace. Without reservation, these common principles represent the bedrock of the work the Atlantic Council does around the world. Equally important, new technologies and data should advance these principles globally.
profile_positions.title: Nonresident Senior Fellow
